required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on July 28, 2020
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Non-Invasive Jugular Venous Blood Volume Assessment (BVI)
clinical_study.official_title: Non-Invasive Jugular Venous Blood Volume Assessment (BVI)

brief_summary.textblock: The purpose of this study is to evaluate the ability of the Mespere Blood Volume Index (BVI) device to calculate the blood volume in the jugular veins by comparing the measurements from the device to volumetric measurements obtained with ultrasound.

primary_outcome.measure: Comparison of jugular vein blood volume
primary_outcome.description: Comparison of measurement of blood volume in jugular vein using BVI and POCUS

secondary_outcome.measure: Comparison of changes in measurement of jugular venous blood volume
secondary_outcome.description: BVI vs POCUS at head of bed angle degrees 0, 30, and 60.

arm_group.description: Cohort to have ultrasound and Mespere BVI device applied.

intervention.description: Non-Invasive measurement of jugular blood volume using Mespere BVI device
Point-of-Care ultrasound of external and internal jugular veins

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
1. 18 years of age or greater
2. English-speaking
3. No known medical conditions requiring treatment by a physician
Exclusion Criteria:
1. Substantial amount of neck hair preventing adhesion of the neck patch of the BVI
2. History of congenital heart disease
3. History of thoracic, neck or brain surgery
4. Inability to lay supine at 30 degrees incline or 60 degrees incline for the duration of the study measurements
5. Pregnancy

facility.name: Integrative Biosciences Center - Clinical Research Service Center
